f6_assessments.q0:
This proposal seeks to solve the problem of corrupt tax systems by an alternative voluntary funding mechanism  which partially aligns with the challenge goal but is not a foundational registry solution listed in the challenge. 
The proposal does a good job of articulating how the solution scales to address future challenges
The proposal could be improved by articulating the value to Cardano ecosystem, providing key metrics and goals that more closely align with the challenge and either selecting another challenge (Miscellaneous) or more closely aligning with this challenge's goals.
f6_assessments.q1:
The proposal articulates the feasibility aspects of a detailed technical explanation of the solution.
The proposal's feasibility could be improved by evidence of experience (partner with someone who has the necessary experience), team composition (skills required at a minimum), a budget that is broken down and reasonable (budget provided is stated to be arbitrary), realistic timetable and plan, and a challenges and risks section.
f6_assessments.q2:
The proposal includes a detailed description of the solution that addresses the problem.
To improve the proposal include a roadmap, milestones, time horizon, metrics/KPIs to measure proposal success and a clear understandable description of the targeted problem.

f6_assessments.q0: The issue being current tax system is corrupt and non transparent. Useful global projects lacks funding the proposer wants to introduce a democratic system where investments from voluntary and anonymous investors are used to fund useful Infrastructure this proposal efficiently addresses the issue.
f6_assessments.q1:
Based on the proposal and by proposer's comments the proposer doesn't have enough experience and don't have a team to implement the proposal successfully.
The proposer have provided a detailed plan and also given short and long term success. But due to not having required experience or experienced team this proposal won't be implemented
f6_assessments.q2: The proposer has given a detailed plans with examples and has also given definition of success after 12months but hasn't provided any timeline or fund breakdown. The proposer wants someone else to come up with the team and an updated plan who will be able to implement the plan successfully Therefore with the provided information it is not possible to clearly track the progress of the proposal

f6_assessments.q0:
The intent of the proposal, while laudable and exciting is not aligned with the intent of the Brief. It is not "Dapp proposals should cover foundational Registry solutions, namely:

National ID & Civil Registry, Property Registration, Medical & Vaccination, Education Census, Revenue Service, Business Incorporations, Elections Voting, Customs & Border Control, Criminal Records, Employment Census, Vehicle Registration, Licensing & Certifications."
f6_assessments.q1: the proposer describes itself as "regrettably useless", therefore, it is consistent that the likelihood of this proposal's successful implementation is less than high.
f6_assessments.q2:
the information provided is not sufficient to audit success or progress toward it, it is not clear what will be done by when. For example "Success after 3-6-12 months:

- Realistically a dapp of this magnitude could take this amount of time or longer just to get basic working codes on a testnet. This is a project with a lifespan equal to that of mankind's need to improve infrastructure and quality of life globally - theoretically eternal. As such it would not be a rushed project."

f6_assessments.q0: This is an ambiguous and great idea. I like the 'trojan horse' approach in the plan. Government tax spending and activities are opaque, bureaucratic, and slow development. This would address development challenges in developing countries. This has the tendency of creating value and ownership by people and gradually face-out government tax system.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposal though great is not showing enough evidence of team's capacity to deliver.
f6_assessments.q2: I think the team should consider a budget breakdown with associated activities to enable the community to know the activities for which funding is being requested.
